DataElement.preferredName: Person Cytochrome P450 3A4 Inhibition Agent Eligibility Determination Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services based on having received an agent that inhibits human CYP3A4 Gene.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Cytochrome P450 3A4 Inhibition Agent Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services based on having received an agent that inhibits human CYP3A4 Gene.

Property.preferredName: Cytochrome P450 3A4 Inhibition Agent Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: Induced primarily in liver by glucocorticoids, drugs, pesticides, and carcinogens and encoded by human CYP3A4 Gene (Cytochrome P450 IIIA Subfamily), Cytochrome P450 3A4 is a 502-amino acid 57.3-kD membrane-bound ER heme-thiolate monooxygenase. CYP3A4 is involved in an NADPH-dependent electron transport pathway and phase I oxidative metabolism of carcinogens, steroids, fatty acids, and xenobiotics, as well as bioactivation of aflatoxin B(1) to a genotoxic derivative. Activity seems a key predictor of drug responsiveness and toxicity. (from LocusLink, Swiss-Prot, OMIM, and NCI):The interference with or prevention of an action or response even though the stimulus for that action or response is present.:An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI):Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: Cytochrome P450 3A4 (503 aa, ~57 kDa) is encoded by the human CYP3A4 gene. This protein is involved in the oxidation of steroids, fatty acids and xenobiotics.
The interference with or prevention of an action or response even though the stimulus for that action or response is present.
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient on medications classified as strong inhibitors of CYP3A4

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did patient receive CYP3A4 in
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient receive CYP3A4 inhibitor during the indicated period

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient on medications classified as strong inhibitors or inducers of CYP3A4

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient currently receiving any of the indicated CYP3A4 strong or moderate inhibitors

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior Treatment with Strong CYP3A4 Inhibitors

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient used strong inhibitors of CYP3A4 (e.g., ketoconazole, itraconazole, clarithromycin, ritonavir, indinavir, nelfinavir, and saquinavir) or strong inducers of CYP3A4 (e.g., rifampin, phenytoin, carbamazepine, phenobarbital, St. John's Wort) within 14 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient used strong inhibitors of CYP3A4 (e.g., clarithromycin, itraconazole, ketoconazole, HCV and HIV protease inhibitors, nefazodone, posaconazole, telithromycin, voriconazole) or strong inducers of CYP3A4 (e.g., carbamazepine, rifampin, phenobarbital, phenytoin, St. John's Wort)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Alliance - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior concomitant use of strong CYP3A4 inhibitors?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received treatment with strong CYP3A4 inhibitors or inducers within 14 days or 5 drug-elimination half lives, whichever is longer, prior to study registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient using known strong (e.g., phenobarbital, enzalutamide, phenytoin, rifampicin, rifabutin, rifapentine, carbamazepine, nevirapine and St John's Wort) or moderate (e.g., bosentan, efavirenz, modafinil) CYP3A4 inducers?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Alliance - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior chronic concomitant treatment with strong CYP3A4 inhibitors?
